intro: Phalangium spirale, commonly known as the spiral phalangium, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually in inflorescences that add to its ornamental value. Botanically, it belongs to the family Araceae, which includes other plants with similar morphological features.
